results.title: Two-lane blacktop [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Monte Hellman, Michael S Laughlin and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A young driver and his mechanic in a souped-up 1955 Chevrolet, living off drag racing bets in the south west, establish a tentative relationship with a girl who tags on to them. They become involved in an indeterminate cross-country race with the middle-aged driver of a new Pontiac GTO. Like other Hellman films, Two-lane Blacktop is a genre film in which the popular elements are not exploited to satisfy audience expectations but are subverted into fresh patterns. This makes it the most determinedly original of the post-Easy Rider road movies, an existential parable which makes striking use of widescreen compositions, long takes and elliptical cuts while denying narrative tension. Instead there is the resonance of character and situation. Hellman has described the film as ‘a love story (about) … how much romance is left in a non-romantic world’, but this is implicit. Cast includes: James Taylor, Warren Oates, Laurie Bird, Dennis Wilson. Also available on VHS.

results.title: Winter Express
results.creator_credit: Anthony Loeb and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: The story of a one-man small town weekly newspaper and the man who run it in Winters, California. The publisher is also a reporter, editor, printer, and distributor. Tells how a weekly functions and how is reflects the virtues of a small town in the United States - an example of the free press.

results.title: Winter's harvest = Raccolta d'inverno
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Council, Brian McKenzie and Angelo Gigliotti
results.brief_description: A documentary on a group of Italian families living in Australia. Shows how they continue some of their traditional customs, in particular the slaughtering and processing of a pig into salami and meat for winter. Captures the essence of traditional Italian family life; the cooperation between families, the division of labour between men and women and the camaraderie that comes from working as a team.

results.title: Winter's harvest
results.brief_description: An Italian family in suburban Melbourne slaughter a pig, make sausages and soups from the flesh, and enjoy a tremendous feast. Brian McKenzie’s fascinating documentary about peasant tradition in the “new world” is a film that asks us to be witness to life and to death, to contemplate the nostalgia of place and displacement, which allows us to remember a world that we have a lost.

results.title: Winstanley. It happened here again
results.creator_credit: Andrew Mollo, Kevin Brownlow and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: In the aftermath of the Civil Wars in 1649, a sect of impoverished men and women, known as the Diggers (or Levellers), formed a communal settlement in Surrey under the leadership of a revolutionary idealist, Gerrard Winstanley. They incurred the resentment of local people stirred up by the parson. On a budget of 30,000 pounds, the filmmakers show meticulous respect for history in pruning away the speculative aspects of the novel and scant regard for the conventions of historical drama on film in recreating the erosion of a dream. The tape also includes ‘It happened here again’, a 50 minute documentary on the making of the film. Cast includes Miles Halliwell, Jerome Willis, Terry Higgins and Phil Oliver. Adapted from the novel “Comrade Jacob” by David Caute and the writings of Gerrard Winstanley.

results.title: Two mules for Sister Sara
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Carroll Case, Martin Rackin and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Two Mules for Sister Sara is a freewheeling, anarchic adventure set in a French-occupied Mexico in the 19th century. An American mercenary (Clint Eastwood) rescues a nun (Shirley Maclaine) from her would-be-molesters, only to later discover that the chance meeting has been a stroke of luck for him, as she knows a great deal about the officers in the garrison he plans to invade. As they embark on a journey together, there develops a sexual tension between the two which comes to an explosive end together with the garrison under attack. Includes a musical score by Ennio Morricone.

results.title: A Life in community
results.creator_credit: Than Van Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Arriving in Australia as a refugee from Vietnam, Than Van Nguyen has dedicated his life to community involvement and the Vietnamese community, with his principal goal being ‘solidarity, unity, being united’.

results.title: Australia - my chosen home
results.creator_credit: Vinh Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vinh’s study trip to Australia in 1997 changed his life forever. Hanoi may have been the place of his childhood memories but Australia would turn out to be a part of his life - his true home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vinh Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Journey to a new land
results.creator_credit: Tuan Anh Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Leaving family and escaping from Vietnam in 1978 and eventually arriving in Australia by boat as a refugee, it would be six years before Tuan Anh Tran could finally be reunited with his family.
